subject: Philosophy
title: Zeno and the Painted Porch
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Zeno and the Painted Porch.

hook.text: Stoicism was born from a shipwreck. Zeno of Citium lost everything and washed up in Athens.

buildup.text: Broke and stranded, he wandered into a bookshop and discovered the philosophy of Socrates.

discovery.text: He began teaching at the Stoa Poikile â€” the Painted Porch â€” giving Stoicism its name.

twist.text: Zeno later said the shipwreck was the best thing that ever happened to him.

climax.text: A philosophy built on losing everything teaches you what really matters.

punchline.text: Stoicism was born from disaster. That's the point.

quiz.question: How did Stoicism get its name?
options: From the Stoa Poikile where Zeno taught
From a Greek word meaning strength
